intro: Gloeospermum gossypium, commonly known as the cotton plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces fluffy, white seed capsules that contain the fibrous seeds used for textile production. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm climate with ample sunlight. Gloeospermum gossypium is an important agricultural crop due to its economic value in the global textile industry.
